newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Nokia, Gradiente to build $20 mln plant.
newsitem.headline: Nokia, Gradiente to build $20 mln plant.

text.p: The local unit of Finland's Nokia AB OY said its new joint venture with local firm Gradiente Eletronica S.A. will invest $20 million to build a cellular telephone plant in Brazil.

Nokia do Brasil Ltda said in a statement that NG Industrial Ltda venture, with Nokia holding 51 percent and Gradiente a 49 percent stake, would enable the firms to prepare for an expected boom in Brazil's cellular market.
The statement said the plant, which would begin producing in 1998's first quarter, also would create 600 new jobs and strengthen the four-year-old relationship between Nokia and Gradiente.
The new factory would produce both Gradiente and Nokia brand cellular phones and serve to meet the marketing and distribution requirements of both companies, it said.

The two firms have been business partners for years, having signed a strategic agreement that allows Gradiente to have access to technology that has made Nokia one of the world's leading cellular equipment suppliers, it added.
